revised_title: Electron Exchange and Scattering in Atomic Systems
tldr: The authors discuss the collision of electrons with simple atomic systems and the importance of electron exchange in understanding the behavior of electrons. They explain how the theory of antisymmetric electron wave functions helps describe the spectra of atoms and the chemical combination between atoms. The authors also apply Oppenheimer's methods to calculate the angular distribution of elastic and inelastic scattering, as well as the probabilities of excitation of triplet states in helium and hydrogen.
